triples.name: Belief revision
triples.relevance: The paper incorporates belief revision theory to develop the logic of conditional doxastic actions.

triples.name: Dynamic logic (modal logic)
triples.relevance: Dynamic logic provides the foundational framework that the paper extends with epistemic actions.

triples.name: Doxastic logic
triples.relevance: Doxastic logic deals with reasoning about beliefs, which is central to the paper's focus on doxastic actions.

triples.name: Epistemic modal logic
triples.relevance: Epistemic logic provides the foundation for reasoning about knowledge and beliefs in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Modal logic
triples.relevance: Modal logic is the foundational mathematical framework underlying both dynamic logic and epistemic logic used in this work.

triples.name: Dynamic epistemic logic
triples.relevance: Dynamic epistemic logic combines dynamic logic with epistemic logic to reason about information change, which relates to the paper's treatment of epistemic actions.

triples.name: Conditional doxastic logic
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel logic of conditional doxastic actions that integrates belief revision with dynamic logic.
